summary: This document is an email chain from August 15, 2019, concerning the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation. It involves a request to expedite phone toll returns from carriers (AT&T, T-Mobile, Sprint, Verizon) via subpoenas, and includes an FBI agent seeking clarification on which carriers are involved.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email chain is in connection with the investigation into his death.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Death Investigation
events.description: Investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein, with law enforcement seeking to expedite phone toll returns from telecommunications carriers via subpoenas.

locations: United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza
keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 15, 2019, related to the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation.
Law enforcement was actively seeking to expedite phone toll returns from major carriers (AT&T, T-Mobile, Sprint, Verizon) via subpoenas.
An FBI agent is involved in the correspondence, seeking clarification on which carriers are targeted.
The correspondence indicates coordination between different parties (possibly AUSAs and FBI) to gather evidence in the investigation.
The document shows investigative efforts were ongoing shortly after Epstein's death in August 2019.
